avalancheActivity.highlights: Freeze thaw cycles recently have made the snow pack stable in most places

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has melted considerably and the snow pack is considered stable in most places.

travelAdvisory.comment: In most places the old snow has subsided, hardend and considered stable in mutliple freeze and thaw cycles. New windslabs have formed in the east in the last few days but freezing level is expected to reach above mountain elevation on Tuesday and Wednesday with rain in high elevations. Snow becomes wet and chances of wet avalanche activity. Some new snow possible in the far north and west in high elevations on Thursday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The old snow has subsided in thaw and frost and is considered stable. Some new windslabs in the east after showers of snow in the last few days. Rain expected and wet avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áfram austlægar áttir, rigning með köflum og frekar hlýtt í veðri en styttiru upp og kólnar á föstudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow has melted or settled in most places and is considered generally stable. Some new snow possible in highest mountains on Thursday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Old snow in the mountains that has melted and subsided. Small windslabs could be present in isolated areas at high elevations on N-NE aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: In most places the old snow has subsided, hardend and considered stable in mutliple freeze and thaw cycles. New windslabs have formed in the east in the last few days but freezing level is expected to reach above mountain elevation on Tuesday and Wednesday with rain in high elevations. Snow becomes wet and chances of wet avalanche activity. Some new snow possible in the far north and west in high elevations on Thursday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The old snow has subsided in thaw and frost and is considered stable. Some new windslabs in the east after showers of snow in the last few days. Rain expected and wet avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snýr í NA-átt og einhver slydda/ringing á láglenid á fimmtudag en snjókoma í hæstu fjöll, skammvinn úrkoma og ekki mikill snjór sem safnas. Kólnar og þurrt á föstudag og laugardag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow has melted or settled in most places and is considered generally stable. Some new snow can accumulate this weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Temperatures have been above freezing point in mountain elevation and froze again and the snow is considered stable and hard in most places.Some new snow can accumulate this weekend.

travelAdvisory.comment: In most places the old snow has subsided, hardend and considered stable in mutliple freeze and thaw cycles. New windslabs have formed in the east in the last few days but freezing level is expected to reach above mountain elevation on Tuesday and Wednesday with rain in high elevations. Snow becomes wet and chances of wet avalanche activity. Some new snow possible in the far north and west in high elevations on Thursday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The old snow has subsided in thaw and frost and is considered stable. Some new windslabs in the east after showers of snow in the last few days. Rain expected and wet avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Breytileg átt og einhver snjókoma til fjalla líklega á fimmtudag og örlítið á laugardag á annesjum.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Rain in mountian elevations on Wednesday and Thursday and increased chance of wet avalanche activity, especially were it rains in new windslabs. Older snow considered rather stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has become wet and continues to rain on Thursday with increased chance on wet avalanche activity. Older snow considered rather stable. Snow becoming more stable on Friday and possible new snow in high elevations on Saturday.

travelAdvisory.comment: In most places the old snow has subsided, hardend and considered stable in mutliple freeze and thaw cycles. New windslabs have formed in the east in the last few days but freezing level is expected to reach above mountain elevation on Tuesday and Wednesday with rain in high elevations. Snow becomes wet and chances of wet avalanche activity. Some new snow possible in the far north and west in high elevations on Thursday.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The old snow has subsided in thaw and frost and is considered stable. Some new windslabs in the east after showers of snow in the last few days. Rain expected and wet avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Breytileg átt næstu dag og rignin hátt til fjalla á fimmtudag en fer hægt kólnandi og fer að snjóa í hæstu fjöll föstudagskvöld. Á laugardag gæti snjóað til fjalla.
